meanings.definition: A line separating two countries, administrative divisions, or areas.
meanings.sent1: The borders between the two countries are heavily guarded.
meanings.sent2: The map shows the borders of the national park.
meanings.sent3: The borders of the puzzle pieces didn't match up, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: The borders of her patience were tested when the meeting ran late.
meanings.sent5: The borders of the garden were marked by colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: The edge or boundary of something.
meanings.sent1: The book was old, with frayed borders on the pages.
meanings.sent2: She painted the room with a border of flowers along the walls.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a delicious chocolate border around the edges.
meanings.sent4: The border of the forest was a mix of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The border of the lake shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To be adjacent to or share a boundary with something.
meanings.sent1: Our backyard borders the park, so we can hear the children playing.
meanings.sent2: The hotel borders the beach, offering stunning ocean views.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to sit by the window and border the outside world.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship borders on obsession, as they do everything together.
meanings.sent5: The mountains border the valley, creating a breathtaking landscape.
